member.name: T:Interprocomm.Client
member.summary: Class used as the client of the application. It will send requests to the server and get back responses from it if needed.

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Client.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Key used to sync the server and the client. It must match the one used for the server.

member.name: P:Interprocomm.Client.Connected
member.summary: Returns true if currently connected to a server.

member.name: P:Interprocomm.Client.Key
member.summary: Returns the key used to connect to the server.

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Client.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects the client from the server. Same as Dispose()

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Client.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the client. Same as Disconnect()

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Client.SendRequest(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Send a request to the server
member.param: The data sent to the server
member.returns: The response from the server, or null if no response has be sent.
member.exception: Thrown if calling this when the client is not connected.

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Client.SendRequest(System.String)
member.summary: Send a request to the server
member.param: The formatted data sent to the server
member.returns: The response from the server, or null if no response has be sent.
member.exception: Thrown if calling this when the client is not connected.

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Client.Start
member.summary: Starts the client and connects it to the server, or waits until a connection can be done.

member.name: T:Interprocomm.Request
member.summary: A request sent by the client.

member.name: P:Interprocomm.Request.Data
member.summary: The raw content of the response.

member.name: P:Interprocomm.Request.StringData
member.summary: A formatted version of the content. It may not work depending of the raw content, if the request was not meant to be formatted.

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Request.Respond(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Respond to the request with data.
member.param: data to respond or null for no response.

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Request.Respond(System.String)
member.summary: Respond to the request with formatted data.

member.name: T:Interprocomm.Response
member.summary: A response from the server after sending a request.

member.name: P:Interprocomm.Response.Data
member.summary: The raw content of the response.

member.name: P:Interprocomm.Response.StringData
member.summary: A formatted version of the content. It may not work depending of the raw content, if the response was not meant to be formatted.

member.name: T:Interprocomm.Server
member.summary: Class used as the server of the application. It will recieve requests from the client application and send back a response if needed.

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Server.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: Key used to sync the server and the client. It must match the one used for the client.

member.name: E:Interprocomm.Server.ClientConnected
member.summary: Event triggered when a client is connected.

member.name: E:Interprocomm.Server.ClientDisconnected
member.summary: Event triggered when a client is disconnected.

member.name: E:Interprocomm.Server.RequestRecieved
member.summary: Event triggered when the client sent a request.

member.name: P:Interprocomm.Server.Connected
member.summary: Returns true if the server is connected with a client.

member.name: P:Interprocomm.Server.Key
member.summary: The key used for the server and the client

member.name: P:Interprocomm.Server.Open
member.summary: Returns true if the server is started and connected/ready to be connected

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Server.Close
member.summary: Closes the server. The Start() method will end and needs to be recalled to reuse the server. Same as Dispose()

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Server.Dispose
member.summary: Dispose the server. Same as Close()

member.name: M:Interprocomm.Server.Start
member.summary: Starts the server. Can only be started once. Method stopped when calling Close() or Dispose().
